SEPW1 is a selenocysteine - containing protein that binds glutathione ( 35) and is thought to act as an antioxidant in vivo ( 36).
The exact molecular function of SEPW1 protein is unknown to date, but a role as antioxidant has been proposed due to its ability to bind glutathione ( 35).
Glutathione efficiently complexes cadmium ( 78) and scavenges free radicals and other reactive oxygen species directly, and indirectly via enzymatic reactions ( 45).

The enhanced sensitivity to cadmium toxicity that we found for mouse embryonic fibroblasts upon a combination of Mtf1 deletion and depletion of glutathione further corroborates the importance of MTF - 1 and its target genes as well as reduced glutathione for an efficient anti - cadmium defense.
